text: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

text: Journaling is like whispering to oneself and listening at the same time.
author: Mina Murray

text: A good journal entry should be like a good conversation—unexpected, revealing, and meaningful.
author: Anonymous

text: Life isn’t about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: An unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

text: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Life is like a camera—focus on what’s important, capture the good times.
author: Anonymous

text: The secret to happiness is freedom... and the secret to freedom is courage.
author: Thucydides

text: Do more things that make you forget to check your phone.
author: Unknown

text: The only journey is the one within.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

text: Your diary knows more about you than your best friend does.
author: Anonymous

text: Write what should not be forgotten.
author: Isabel Allende

text: Don’t wait. The time will never be just right.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: You can’t start the next chapter if you keep re-reading the last one.
author: Anonymous

text: Live your days with purpose, or they'll pass without meaning.
author: Anonymous

text: A day without laughter is a day wasted.
author: Charlie Chaplin

text: Most people exist, few actually live.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Journals are time machines that take you back to who you were.
author: Anonymous

text: The bad news is time flies. The good news is you’re the pilot.
author: Michael Altshuler

text: Fill your paper with the breathings of your heart.
author: William Wordsworth

text: Everything you can imagine is real.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: Write your worries in the sand and carve your joys in stone.
author: Anonymous

text: Don’t count the days, make the days count.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: We write to taste life twice, in the moment and in retrospect.
author: Anaïs Nin

text: Every new day is a blank page in your story.
author: Anonymous

text: If you tell the truth, you don’t have to remember anything.
author: Mark Twain

text: A journal is a conversation with yourself.
author: Anonymous

text: The best moments in life are often unplanned.
author: Anonymous

text: Life is too important to be taken seriously.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Live in such a way that your journal would make a great book.
author: Anonymous

text: No one has ever become poor by giving.
author: Anne Frank

text: Journaling is self-care in ink.
author: Anonymous

text: You never realize how short a month is until you start journaling daily.
author: Anonymous

text: A year from now, you'll wish you started today.
author: Anonymous

text: It’s not what you look at that matters, it’s what you see.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: The purpose of life is a life of purpose.
author: Robert Byrne

text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: Nothing is worth more than this day.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: The first step towards getting somewhere is to decide you’re not staying where you are.
author: J.P. Morgan

text: We do not remember days, we remember moments.
author: Cesare Pavese

text: Write it down. You'll thank yourself later.
author: Anonymous

text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: A day spent without writing is a day wasted.
author: Anonymous

text: Your journal is your past self speaking to your future self.
author: Anonymous

text: The quieter you become, the more you can hear.
author: Ram Dass

text: You can’t change the past, but you can ruin the present by worrying about the future.
author: Anonymous
